result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

2:12 PM Defendant Joshua Michael Coleman in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant dates he is not eligible for a public defender 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.
Filed by Prosecutor. Date: October 17, 2022 at 2 pm, Br 3.

2:36 PM Defendant Joshua Michael Coleman not in court.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
ADA Dodge would ask for a warrant with a $750 cash alternative.
ADA Dodge would ask that the signature bond be forfeited 

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $750 cash alternative
$1,500 Signature bond forfeited
Initial Appearance set for 09/12/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 2

No contact with Walmart in Plover.
Defendant not to have contact juveniles L.G., G.H., and T.S. except for coincidental involving children at school or events.

1:04 PM Defendant Joshua Michael Coleman appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.
Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft and Contribute to Delinquency of Child. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is not eligible for a public defender attorney.
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
